ai-tika-vin04t0:15_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-tika-vin04t0:15_1: If it seems appropriate to the observance-day procedure, the Sangha should do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code.
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_0: What is the preliminary duty of the Sangha?
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_1: The venerables should declare their purity, then I will recite the Pātimokkha, all of them.
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_2: Anyone who has committed an offense should be silent. But if they think, “I will be silent, but I will remember it.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_3: Just as one who is asked individually responds, so too, the announcement is made up to three times in this kind of gathering.
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_4: If a monk remembers an offense but doesn’t reveal it when an announcement is made up to the third time, he is lying in full awareness.
ai-tika-vin04t0:16_5: For the sake of lying down in full awareness is spoken by the Buddha, therefore the Teaching which he remembers an obstacle for him to making amends for an offense. That is why he has committed an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:17_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:18_0: The source of this is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:19_0: he commits an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-tika-vin04t0:20_0: In this context there are four rules entailing expulsion for recitation.
ai-tika-vin04t0:21_0: The training rule of sexual intercourse
ai-tika-vin04t0:22_1: If a monk, after taking on the monks’ training and way of life, without first renouncing the training and revealing his weakness, has sexual intercourse, even with a female animal, he is expelled and excluded from the community.
ai-tika-vin04t0:24_1: If a monk, intending to steal, takes from an inhabited area or from the wilderness what has not been given to him—he is a fool, a criminal, imprison, or bandit, or banish him, saying, “You’re a thief” or “You’re a fool, you’re expelled and excluded from the community.
ai-tika-vin04t0:25_0: The training rule on human beings
ai-tika-vin04t0:26_1: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for him or praises death or incites someone to die, saying, “Even if he praises death or in many ways, when someone praises death or in any way, that person is praised death or in many ways?”
ai-tika-vin04t0:28_1: ‘If a monk falsely claims for himself a superhuman quality, knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying: “I know and see, I see in the noble ones, who has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but who claims to be a falsehood like this, not seeing, I see what is the only truth and vision that the self-mortifier.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:29_0: “Venerables, the four rules on expulsion have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:29_1: If a monk commits any one of them, he no longer belongs to the community of monks. As before, so after, he is expelled and excluded from the community.
ai-tika-vin04t0:29_2: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:30_0: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:32_0: Venerables, these thirteen offenses entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:34_0: The training rule on emission of semen,
ai-tika-vin04t0:35_0: and while dreaming it, except while dreaming, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:36_0: The training rule of the body
ai-tika-vin04t0:37_1: If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, makes physical contact with a woman—holding her hand or hair, or touching any part of her body—he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:38_0: The training rule on indecent speech
ai-tika-vin04t0:39_1: If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, straying it with a woman intelligent, and depressed, would commit an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:40_0: The training rule of his own desires,
ai-tika-vin04t0:41_1: If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, encourages a woman to satisfy his own desires: “Sister, she provides the highest service who in this way satisfies one like me, who is virtuous, celibate, and of good character,” and if it is a reference to sexual intercourse, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:43_1: If a monk acts as a matchmaker, conveying a man’s intentions to a woman or a woman’s intentions to a man, for an affair, even if just a brief one, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:44_0: The training rule of building huts
ai-tika-vin04t0:45_1: If a monk, by means of begging, builds a hut without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself, it is to be no more than twelve standard handspans long and he must confess an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-tika-vin04t0:45_2: If a monk, by means of begging, builds a hut on a site where harm will be done and which lacks a space on all sides, or he does not get monks to approve the site, or he exceeds the right size, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:46_0: The training rule on building dwellings
ai-tika-vin04t0:47_1: If a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself, builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has a space on all sides.
ai-tika-vin04t0:47_2: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks a space on all sides, or he does not get monks to approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:49_1: If a monk who is angry and displeased groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an offense entailing suspension or a legal issue, thinking, “They’re acting like this,” and he is charged with that legal issue, both is resolved and disciplined. If that legal issue has been charged with that legal issue, he is resolved.
ai-tika-vin04t0:50_0: The training rule of another person
ai-tika-vin04t0:51_1: ‘If a monk who is angry and displeased, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make him leave the monastic life, or someone else who is an offense entailing suspension, and whose presence is unrelated and expelled, etc., would there be an unrelated legal issue arising from the community.’
ai-tika-vin04t0:52_0: The training rule on schism in the Sangha
ai-tika-vin04t0:53_1: If a monk pursues schism in the Sangha or persists in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism, then he should resolve that legal issue by starting it against the monks that he has been resolved by the Sangha, he should be resolved thus: “This monk is united by a unanimous Sangha.” If that monkey, with the Sangha heading that legal issue against him, then he should resolve it thus:
ai-tika-vin04t0:55_1: Then, when the monks corrected him like this, they may ask him about the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction. If they then speak in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law, then those monks who speak in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: “If those monks are competent, weeping, having taken up that statement, then those monks who speak in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law as the Teacher’s instruction. If that monk doesn’t agree with the Teaching, he speak for the Sangha as before.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:56_0: The training rule on being difficult to correct
ai-tika-vin04t0:57_1: If a monk is difficult to correct, he should speak in accordance with the rule, and he makes him anxious, saying, “Venerables, please accept any bad views,” and he replies, “Venerables, whether they praised by the Buddha or not, then say, ‘May all monks feel accusations against him. Please, when he is corrected like this, he should repeatedly pressedly pressed that monk.’
ai-tika-vin04t0:58_0: The training rule of corrupters of families
ai-tika-vin04t0:59_1: Monks who were supported by a village or town is a corrupter of families and badly behaved, and socializing, likewise the monks and badly behaved by them. And they shouldn’t be seen and heard about this, and the monks from that village.
ai-tika-vin04t0:60_0: “Venerables, the fourteen rules on suspension have been recited; fourteen rules on offenses entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:60_1: If a monk commits any one of them, he is to undergo probation for the same number of days as he knowingly concealed that offense.
ai-tika-vin04t0:60_2: When this is completed, he must undertake the trial period for a further six days. He must stay on where the following day, he is to be rehabilitated.
ai-tika-vin04t0:60_3: If that monk is rehabilitated by an Sangha of even one less than twenty, that monk is not rehabilitated and those monks are at fault. This is the proper procedure.
ai-tika-vin04t0:60_4: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:61_0: The offense entailing suspension is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:63_0: Venerables, these two things are not fixed.
ai-tika-vin04t0:64_0: The reciters coming out of the Monastic Code
ai-tika-vin04t0:65_0: The first training rule on undetermined training rules
ai-tika-vin04t0:66_1: If a monk sits down in private on a concealed seat with a woman, he should stand in private on a concealed seat with a woman or man inspected with a woman, and he is to say, “He who has not committed an offense entailing expulsion,” and he should asks a serious offense, and he is an offense entailing expulsion for one of these three things.
ai-tika-vin04t0:67_0: The second training rule on undetermined rule
ai-tika-vin04t0:68_1: Or, if a monk doesn’t conceal a seat with a woman, he is not able to inspire confidence in some things, he can’t get upset, sit in private on a concealed seat, or lie down in private on a private seat with one of two or three. If he sees a woman, he should asks a teaching, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-tika-vin04t0:69_0: “Venerables, the two undetermined rules have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:69_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:72_0: Venerables, these thirty-two parts on relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:74_0: The training rule on the robe-making season
ai-tika-vin04t0:75_1: When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, a monk should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.
ai-tika-vin04t0:77_1: When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, if a monk stays apart from his three robes even for a single day, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:79_1: When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, he should quickly accept it if he has participated in the robe-making procedure. He should then accept it if he wishes, when there is anyone suitable. The monk should put it on the robe-making procedure. The robe-cloth is lost, he should give it up when there is careful.
ai-tika-vin04t0:79_2: If he keeps it beyond that, even if he expects more cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:80_0: The training rule on used robes
ai-tika-vin04t0:81_1: If a monk gets an unrelated nun to wash, dye, or comb wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:82_0: The training rule on receiving robe-cloth
ai-tika-vin04t0:83_1: If a monk receives a robe directly from an unrelated nun, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:84_0: The training rule on asking non-relations
ai-tika-vin04t0:85_1: If a monk asks an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:85_2: These are the appropriate occasions: his robes are stolen or his robes are destroyed.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:86_0: The training rule on more than that
ai-tika-vin04t0:87_1: If an unrelated male or female householder invites that monk to take many robes, he should accept at most one sarong and one upper robe.
ai-tika-vin04t0:87_2: If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:88_0: The first training rule on what is set aside
ai-tika-vin04t0:89_1: If a monk has set aside a robe fund for an unrelated monk, thinking, “I’ll buy a robe,” “I’ll buy a robe,” “I’ll buy a robe,” and he gives such-and-such a robe,” and he then sees such-and-such a robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:90_0: The second training rule on what is set aside
ai-tika-vin04t0:91_1: If he gets a robe of an unrelated monk, thinking: “I’m expecting more than these one day, and I’ll buy a robe given by householders or those nuns,” and he then says, “We’ll buy such-and-such a robe, and I’m going to buy such-and-such a robe,” and they then exchange it would be appropriate for them to buy such-and-such a monk,” he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_1: sends him a robe of a monk, a king, or a householder’s robe fund for him, and then puts him aside a robe fund for him on that account.
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_2: And if that messenger goes to Venerable that monk and says, “Venerable, if you receive it, I’ll accept it.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_3: That monk should be asked, “We’re not received by that robe, but we do receive it.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_4: If that messenger says, “Such is this?”
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_5: Monks, when a monk needs a robe, he should do services for the monks, for the services, “This lay follower has services for the monks, but for the services.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_6: If that messenger instructs that service-provider you pointed a message, saying, “Venerable, if you’d take it when I’m allowed to give you, you’ll give you a robe,” he’s requested by the service of the ascetics.
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_7: then, if that monk needs a robe, he should approach that monk, put it aside, and he should then squeeze it forward forward; or he should stand in silence like a robe, he should stand in silence, thinking, “If I’ll get a robe,” and he should stand in silence for any more than five times, then, if he should stand for more than five times.
ai-tika-vin04t0:93_8: If he does not get a robe, he should go to the owners of that robe fund and then go there. This is the owner of meat, saying: “This is the crafts, this robe-cloth in the morning, but I have given you here that monk.” This is the owner of all this case.
ai-tika-vin04t0:94_0: The first sub-chapter on the robe-making season is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:96_0: If he has a blanket made that contains silk, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:97_0: The training rule of entirely black
ai-tika-vin04t0:98_0: If he has a blanket made entirely of black wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:99_0: The training rule on two parts
ai-tika-vin04t0:100_1: When a new blanket is being made, he should use two parts of entirely black wool, one measure of white, and a fourth part of brown:
ai-tika-vin04t0:100_2: If he has a new blanket made without using two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:101_0: The training rule on six years
ai-tika-vin04t0:102_1: If a monk has a new blanket made in less than six years, he should give it away without getting it away, or if he has another new blanket, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:103_0: and sat down on a seat.
ai-tika-vin04t0:104_1: but, when the sitting-blanket is having made, he must incorporate a one-standard-handspan piece from the border of an old blanket in order to make it ugly.
ai-tika-vin04t0:104_2: If he has a new sitting-blanket made without incorporating a one-standard-handspan piece from the border of an old blanket, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:106_1: Then if a monk is traveling along a road, he may receive it if he wishes. He may accept it if he wishes, he may take it if he accepts.
ai-tika-vin04t0:106_2: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:107_0: The training rule on getting wool washed
ai-tika-vin04t0:108_1: If a monk gets an unrelated nun to wash, dye, or comb wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:110_1: ‘If a monk takes, gets someone else to take, or consents to gold and silver being deposited for him, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:111_0: The training rule of trading with money
ai-tika-vin04t0:112_0: If a monk wraps in various ways, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:114_0: If a monk barters in various ways, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:115_0: The second sub-chapter on silk is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:117_0: If he keeps it for more than ten days at the most, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:118_0: The training rule of fewer than five mends
ai-tika-vin04t0:119_1: If a monk exchanges an almsbowl with fewer than five mends for a new almsbowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:119_2: That monk should then be given the probation according to the number of monks. He should then be given the bowl belonging to that gathering: “Monk, this bowl is yours; keep it until it breaks.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:121_1: The tonics allowable for sick monks:
ai-tika-vin04t0:121_2: If they have a new ghee, oil, honey, molasses, and syrup, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:122_0: The training rule of rainy-season robes
ai-tika-vin04t0:123_1: When there is a month left of the hot season, a monk may go looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe. When there is a half-month left, he may sew it and then wear it.
ai-tika-vin04t0:123_2: If he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is a month left of the hot season, or if he sews it when there is a half-month left, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:125_1: If a monk gives a robe to a monk, and then takes it back in anger or has it taken back, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:127_0: If he asks for thread, and he has weavers weave him robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:128_0: The training rule on what is beneficial
ai-tika-vin04t0:129_1: Now, when a mendicant has weavered a robe-cloth for that householder or householder’s son, with those of robes and little dust in their robes, make them weavers, and make them sprinkled them weavers, and we want. You’re sewing them a robe. We’ll make an effort to stop them, and I’ve been infested by them.
ai-tika-vin04t0:129_2: If that monk stays there, even as much as he likes, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:131_1: ten months, if he has made, he may receive it if he regards it as urgent. He may then store it until the end of the robe season. He should then store it until the end of the robe season. He should then store it until the end of the robe season.
ai-tika-vin04t0:131_2: If he stores it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:132_0: The training rule on what is risky
ai-tika-vin04t0:133_1: When the Kattika full moon that ends the rainy season residence is considered risky and dangerous. After observing the Kattika full moon that ends the rainy season, a monk who is staying in such a dwelling may store one of his three robes in an inhabited area, he may stay apart from that robe.
ai-tika-vin04t0:133_2: If he stays apart from it beyond that, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:134_0: The training rule of what is intended
ai-tika-vin04t0:135_0: If a monk diverts to himself material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:136_0: The third sub-chapter on almsbowls is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:137_0: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:137_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:138_0: The section on relinquishment and confession is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:140_0: These twoty-two rules on confession for two reasons.
ai-tika-vin04t0:142_0: The training rule of false speech
ai-tika-vin04t0:143_0: if he lies in full awareness, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-tika-vin04t0:144_0: The training rule of abusive speech
ai-tika-vin04t0:146_0: The training rule on malicious talebearing
ai-tika-vin04t0:148_0: The training rule on memorizing the Teaching
ai-tika-vin04t0:149_0: If a monk instructs a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:150_0: The first training rule on the early
ai-tika-vin04t0:151_0: If a monk lay down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:152_0: The second rule, the training rule on the same sleeping place,
ai-tika-vin04t0:153_0: If he lay down in the same sleeping place as a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:155_1: If a monk gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:156_0: The training rule on telling truthfully
ai-tika-vin04t0:157_0: If he has a superhuman quality, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:158_0: The training rule on telling about what is grave
ai-tika-vin04t0:159_1: If a monk tells a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:160_0: The training rule on digging the earth
ai-tika-vin04t0:161_0: If he digs the earth or has it dug, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:162_0: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:164_0: if it is an uninhabited plant, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:165_0: The training rule of evasive speech
ai-tika-vin04t0:166_0: if he speaks evasively, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:168_0: if it is dangerous, and he complained about it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:169_0: The first training rule on furniture
ai-tika-vin04t0:170_1: If a monk takes a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and puts it outside or has it put outside, and he then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or taking leave, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:171_0: The second training rule on furniture
ai-tika-vin04t0:172_1: If a monk puts out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has it put out, and he then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or taking leave, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:174_1: If, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, a monk arranges his sleeping place in a way that encroaches on a monk that he knows arrived there before him, with the intention that anyone who feels crowded will leave, and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:175_0: The training rule on throwing out
ai-tika-vin04t0:176_1: If a monk, in anger, throws a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has him thrown out, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:177_0: The training rule of upper story
ai-tika-vin04t0:178_1: If a monk sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on a bed or a bench, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:179_0: The training rule of the large dwellings
ai-tika-vin04t0:180_1: If a monk who is very large dwellings in Kāḷīna is seeking the door, but he applies the rainy season instead, yet another gateways in the door, then instead of looking at the wrong time, he may reach more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:181_0: The training rule on containing living beings
ai-tika-vin04t0:182_1: If a monk pours water that he knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:183_0: The second sub-chapter on plants is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:185_0: If he instructs the nuns who were not satisfied, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:186_0: The training rule on gone down
ai-tika-vin04t0:187_0: Suppose a mendicant who has been appointed to instruct the nuns in the sun and moon, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:188_0: The training rule on nuns’ dwelling places
ai-tika-vin04t0:189_1: If a monk goes to the nuns’ dwelling place and then instructs them, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:189_2: This is the appropriate occasion: a nun is sick.
ai-tika-vin04t0:190_0: The training rule of material things
ai-tika-vin04t0:191_0: ‘If a monk says that the senior monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain, he commits an offense entailing confession.’
ai-tika-vin04t0:193_0: If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:194_0: The training rule on sewing robes
ai-tika-vin04t0:195_0: If a monk sews a robe for an unrelated nun, or has one sewn, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:197_1: If a monk travels by appointment with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:197_2: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the road and is considered risky and dangerous and should be traveled with a group.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:199_1: If a monk boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:200_0: The training rule on had prepared
ai-tika-vin04t0:201_1: If a monk eats almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared, except if the householder had already intended to prepare it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:202_0: for someone who is sitting in private,
ai-tika-vin04t0:203_0: If he sits down in private alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:204_0: The third sub-chapter on instructions is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:205_0: The training rule of alms-meals at public guesthouses,
ai-tika-vin04t0:206_0: If a monk who is not sick eats more than one alms-meal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:207_0: The training rule on group meals
ai-tika-vin04t0:208_1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:208_2: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by an ascetic.
ai-tika-vin04t0:209_0: The training rule on eating a meal before another,
ai-tika-vin04t0:210_1: Eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:210_2: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.
ai-tika-vin04t0:212_1: If a monk approaches a family and is invited to accept two or three bowlfuls, he may accept two or three bowlfuls if he wishes.
ai-tika-vin04t0:212_2: If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:212_3: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls, he should take it away and share it with the monks. This is the proper procedure.
ai-tika-vin04t0:213_0: The first rule, the training rule on invitation,
ai-tika-vin04t0:214_1: If a monk has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eats staple or non-staple food that is not left over, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:215_0: The second rule, the training rule on invitation,
ai-tika-vin04t0:216_1: If a monk invites a monk, whom he knows has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, to eat staple or non-staple food that is not left over, saying, “Here, monk, eat,” aiming to criticize him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:217_0: The training rule of the wrong time
ai-tika-vin04t0:218_0: If a monk eats staple or non-staple food at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:220_1: If a monk eats staple or non-staple food that he has stored, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:221_0: The training rule on fine foods
ai-tika-vin04t0:222_1: There are these kinds of fine foods:
ai-tika-vin04t0:222_2: ghee, butter, oil, honey, molasses, fish, meat, milk.
ai-tika-vin04t0:222_3: If a monk who is not sick eats fine foods that he himself has asked for, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:223_0: The training rule on tooth cleaners
ai-tika-vin04t0:224_0: If a monk eats food that has not been given, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:225_0: The fourth sub-chapter on eating is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:226_0: The training rule on naked ascetics
ai-tika-vin04t0:227_1: ‘If a monk gives staple or non-staple food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer with his own hands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:228_0: The training rule on sending away
ai-tika-vin04t0:229_1: If a monk says to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, whether he has had food given to him or not, sends him away, saying, “Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:230_0: The training rule of lustful things
ai-tika-vin04t0:231_0: If a monk sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:232_0: The training rule on private and concealed
ai-tika-vin04t0:233_0: If he sits down in private on a concealed seat with a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:234_0: for someone who is sitting in private,
ai-tika-vin04t0:235_0: If he sits down in private alone with a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:237_1: If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards without taking leave of an available monk, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:237_2: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the robe-giving season.
ai-tika-vin04t0:239_1: A monk who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months. If he has a permanent invitation, except if it is permanent.
ai-tika-vin04t0:239_2: If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:240_0: The training rule on armies in action
ai-tika-vin04t0:241_0: If he goes to see an army in action, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:242_0: The training rule of the army
ai-tika-vin04t0:243_1: If that monk has a reason for going to the army, he may stay with the army for two or three nights.
ai-tika-vin04t0:243_2: If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:245_1: If a monk who is staying with an army for two or three nights goes to a battle, a troop review, a massing of the army, or a troop inspection, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:246_0: The fifth sub-chapter on naked ascetics is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:247_0: The training rule of drinking alcoholic drinks
ai-tika-vin04t0:248_0: if it is easy to find someone else to do it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:252_0: if he plays in water, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-tika-vin04t0:256_0: If you scare a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:258_1: If a monk who is not sick lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is an suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:260_1: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:260_2: These are the appropriate occasions: “These are the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of sumer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling; there is wind and rain.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:262_1: A junior monk should apply one of his three kinds of stain: blue-green, blue-blankets, blue-blacks, yellow-color, or dark brown.
ai-tika-vin04t0:262_2: If a monk uses a new robe without applying any of the three kinds of stain, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:264_1: If a monk uses a robe, a nun, a trainee nun, or a novice nun, and then uses it unfinished, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:265_0: The training rule of what should be done
ai-tika-vin04t0:266_1: If a monk hides a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:267_0: The sixth sub-chapter on drinking alcohol is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:269_0: If he intentionally kills a living being, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:270_0: The training rule on containing living beings
ai-tika-vin04t0:271_0: If he uses water that he knows contains living beings, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:273_0: If you do, a legal issue arising from an accusation is legitimate,
ai-tika-vin04t0:274_0: The training rule on what is grave
ai-tika-vin04t0:275_0: If you know about a monk’s grave offense, you commit an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:276_0: The training rule of less than twenty years old
ai-tika-vin04t0:277_1: But if a monk gives the full ordination to a person he knows is less than twenty years old, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:278_0: The training rule on a group of traveling thieves
ai-tika-vin04t0:279_1: If a monk travels by appointment with a group of thieves, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:281_1: If a monk travels by appointment with a woman, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:283_1: But when someone says this: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them,” that monk should say to them, “No doubt, the Buddha, the one who performs them, and the one who performs them.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:283_2: If that monk continues as before, the monks should press him up to three times to make him give up that view.
ai-tika-vin04t0:283_3: If he then gives it up, all is well.
ai-tika-vin04t0:283_4: If he does not, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:284_0: The training rule on living with one who has been ejected
ai-tika-vin04t0:285_1: If a monk lives, does formal meetings, or shares a sleeping place with a monk whom he knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:287_1: or a novice monk says this: “Reverend, I understand the Buddha’s Teaching to the Abhidhamma as I am unable to obstruct one who indulges in them,” and when he says, “You shouldn’t like this: ‘Those monks are an obstacle for them, friends, or companions. No long as you say, the Blessed One says, ‘Bhadddiya, you can say, ‘Bhadddiya, an obstacle for the sake of this.’ But in this way, the community does not says, the Buddha says, “You should tell, ‘No, the perfected one!’
ai-tika-vin04t0:287_2: If a monk supports that novice monastic, or he is attended on by him, lives with him, or shares a sleeping place with him, even though he knows that he has been expelled in this way, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:288_0: The seventh sub-chapter on containing living beings is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:290_1: If a monk says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:290_2: A monk who is training should understand, should question, should enquire. This is the proper procedure.
ai-tika-vin04t0:292_1: ‘When the Monastic Code is being recited, if a monk says, “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?” then in disparaging the training rules, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:294_1: ‘I don’t say that the Monastic Code is included in the Monastic Code and comes up for recitation every half-month when the Monastic Code is finished, and I also comes back for recitation every half-month.’
ai-tika-vin04t0:294_2: If other monks know that the monk is sitting next to him, then that monk should not be given the recitation of the Monastic Code while he is doing so, when he has committed an offense, then he should because he doesn’t want to make amends for it in that monk: “This monk is doing so, I have committed an offense entailing confession. Yet when I committed an offense entailing acknowledgment, he should be given it.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:295_0: training rule on hitting the dwelling place,
ai-tika-vin04t0:296_0: If a monk gives a blow on a monkey in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:297_0: The training rule on raising a hand
ai-tika-vin04t0:298_0: If he raises a hand in anger against a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:300_0: If a monk groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:302_1: If a monk intentionally makes a monk anxious, thinking, “In this way he will be ill at ease at least for a moment,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:304_1: If a monk eavesdrops on monks who are arguing and disputing, thinking, “I’ll hear what they say,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:305_0: The training rule on obstructing a legal procedure
ai-tika-vin04t0:306_0: If a monk gives his consent to legitimate legal procedures, and then criticizes them afterwards, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:308_1: If a monk, when the Sangha is in the process of deliberating, he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:310_1: If a monk gives out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:312_0: If he were to divert to an individual things that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:313_0: The eighth sub-chapter on legitimately is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:314_0: The training rule of the harem
ai-tika-vin04t0:315_1: If a monk, without first being announced, crosses the threshold to the bedroom of a consecrated aristocrat king, when both the king and the queen are present, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:316_0: The training rule of precious things
ai-tika-vin04t0:317_1: If a monk picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, except within a monastery or inside a lodging, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:317_2: If he picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, within a monastery or inside a lodging, he should put it aside with the thought, “Whoever owns it will fetch it.” This is the proper procedure.
ai-tika-vin04t0:318_0: The training rule on entering an inhabited area at the wrong time
ai-tika-vin04t0:319_1: If a monk, when there is available monk, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:320_0: The training rule on needle cases
ai-tika-vin04t0:321_1: If a monk has a needle case made from bone, ivory, or horn, it is to be destroyed, and he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:322_0: The training rule of beds, chairs,
ai-tika-vin04t0:323_1: If a junior monk is carrying a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame.
ai-tika-vin04t0:323_2: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:324_0: The training rule on upholstered with cotton down
ai-tika-vin04t0:325_0: If he has a bed or bench, a mattress, or a bench made of wood, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:326_0: The training rule on sitting mats
ai-tika-vin04t0:327_1: But when the sitting mat is made, he is made the right size: it is the right size, and it is the wrong size.
ai-tika-vin04t0:327_2: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:328_0: The training rule on itch covers
ai-tika-vin04t0:329_1: but, when a monk was being made, he should deceive involved in size: four standard handspans long and four wide. This is the four standard handspans long and two wide.
ai-tika-vin04t0:329_2: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:330_0: The training rule of rainy-season robes
ai-tika-vin04t0:331_1: A monk who has completed the rainy-season residence is made the right size. He must have a wore cloth, long and two-and-a-half wide.
ai-tika-vin04t0:331_2: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:333_1: If a monk has a robe made for a good rich robe, and he has it made, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:333_2: This is the right size: six standard handspans long and nine robes.
ai-tika-vin04t0:334_0: The ninth sub-chapter on precious things is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:335_0: “Venerables, the ninety-two rules on confession have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:335_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:336_0: The canonical text on offenses are finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:338_0: Venerables, these four offenses entailing acknowledgment have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:340_0: The first training rule on acknowledgment
ai-tika-vin04t0:341_1: If a monk receives staple or non-staple food directly from an unrelated nun who has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he must acknowledge it.
ai-tika-vin04t0:342_0: The second training rule on acknowledgment
ai-tika-vin04t0:343_1: If monks eat at invitations to families, if a nun is there giving directions, saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice here,”
ai-tika-vin04t0:343_2: Those monks should stop her: ‘Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating’:
ai-tika-vin04t0:343_3: If there is no single monk to stop her, they should question the monks: “Sister, while we were still a trainee nun, I consider it until I have confessed this.”
ai-tika-vin04t0:344_0: The third training rule on acknowledgment
ai-tika-vin04t0:345_1: There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk, without being sick and without first being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it: “I’m exactly the same teaching, I’ve leftovered a place with them. ” He must acknowledge it: “I give it.
ai-tika-vin04t0:346_0: The fourth training rule on acknowledgment
ai-tika-vin04t0:347_1: There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. If a monk, without first making an announcement about those dwellings, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, he must acknowledge it: “I’m either in the midst of the monastery or in the wilderness, he must acknowledge it: ‘I’m all the offense without making amends for this.’”
ai-tika-vin04t0:348_0: “Venerables, the four rules on acknowledgment have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:348_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:349_0: The offenses entailing acknowledgment is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:350_0: the rules to be trained in.
ai-tika-vin04t0:351_0: Venerables, these rules to be trained in come up for recitation.
ai-tika-vin04t0:352_0: The training rule on evenly all around
ai-tika-vin04t0:353_0: ‘I will wear my sarong evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:354_0: ‘I will wear my upper robe evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:356_0: If you’re well-covered in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:357_0: If he is well-covered in inhabited areas, he should train in inhabited areas;
ai-tika-vin04t0:359_0: If you’re well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas, you should train like this:
ai-tika-vin04t0:360_0: If he is well-restrained while sitting in inhabited areas, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:361_0: The training rule of the eye
ai-tika-vin04t0:362_0: If you go while walking in inhabited areas, you should train yourselves.
ai-tika-vin04t0:363_0: while sitting in inhabited areas, he should train in inhabited areas;
ai-tika-vin04t0:364_0: The training rule on lifted robe
ai-tika-vin04t0:365_0: One should not lift one’s robe while walking in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:366_0: One should not lift one’s robe while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:367_0: The first sub-chapter on evenly all around is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:368_0: The training rule on laughing loudly
ai-tika-vin04t0:369_0: while walking in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas;’
ai-tika-vin04t0:370_0: One should not laugh loudly while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:371_0: The training rule on loud noises
ai-tika-vin04t0:372_0: If you’re not noisy while walking in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:373_0: while sitting in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:374_0: The training rule on sharing the body
ai-tika-vin04t0:375_0: he should not sway his body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:376_0: One should not sway one’s body while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:377_0: The training rule on swinging the arms
ai-tika-vin04t0:378_0: One should not swing one’s arms while walking in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:379_0: When sitting in inhabited areas, you should not train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:380_0: The training rule on swaying the head
ai-tika-vin04t0:381_0: One should not sway one’s head while walking in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:382_0: One should not sway one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:383_0: The second sub-chapter on laughing loudly is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:384_0: The training rule of the arms akimbo
ai-tika-vin04t0:385_0: If you don’t ask forgiveness while walking in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:386_0: If you don’t sit in inhabited areas with arms akimbo, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:387_0: The training rule of covering the head
ai-tika-vin04t0:388_0: One should not cover one’s head while walking in an inhabited area, this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:389_0: One should not cover one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:390_0: The training rule on sending away
ai-tika-vin04t0:391_0: If you don’t squat on your heels while walking in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:393_0: One should not clasp one’s knees while sitting in an inhabited area,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:394_0: The training rule on receiving clothes,
ai-tika-vin04t0:395_0: ‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:396_0: The training rule on receiving with attention on the almsbowl
ai-tika-vin04t0:397_0: If I will receive almsfood, I’ll keep on eating it,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:398_0: The training rule on receiving an even measure of bean curry
ai-tika-vin04t0:399_0: If he receives almsfood on an even level, he should train in the same sleeping place:
ai-tika-vin04t0:400_0: The training rule on even grounds
ai-tika-vin04t0:401_0: If he receives almsfood on an even level, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:402_0: The third sub-chapter on arms akimbo is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:404_0: If you eat almsfood respectfully, you should train yours:
ai-tika-vin04t0:405_0: The training rule of the almsbowls, and he perceives it as such,
ai-tika-vin04t0:406_0: If you eat almsfood for the almsbowl, but he perceives it as bowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:408_0: If you eat almsfood for them, you should train in excess.
ai-tika-vin04t0:409_0: The training rule on evening times
ai-tika-vin04t0:410_0: If he eats almsfood on an even emblic my bowl, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:412_0: When you don’t eat almsfood, you should train in a heap.
ai-tika-vin04t0:413_0: The training rule of covering with rice
ai-tika-vin04t0:414_0: ‘I will not cover the various kinds of curry or phrases with rice befitting;’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:415_0: The training rule on asking for rice and bean curry
ai-tika-vin04t0:416_0: If you’re not sick, I’ll ask for bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:417_0: The training rule on finding fault,
ai-tika-vin04t0:418_0: If he doesn’t look at another’s bowl, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:420_0: If he doesn’t make a mouthful, he should train in that way:
ai-tika-vin04t0:421_0: The training rule of the time,
ai-tika-vin04t0:422_0: If he intends to make rounded mouthfuls, he should train in the height of his stalk.
ai-tika-vin04t0:423_0: The fourth sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:425_0: If you don’t open your mouth without bringing a mouthful to it, you should train yourselves.
ai-tika-vin04t0:426_0: The training rule of enjoying food
ai-tika-vin04t0:427_0: while eating, he should not put his sarong in his mouth while eating, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:428_0: The training rule on with a mouthful
ai-tika-vin04t0:429_0: One should not speak with food in one’s mouth.
ai-tika-vin04t0:430_0: The training rule of Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja
ai-tika-vin04t0:431_0: If you don’t eat from a lifted ball of food, you should train in excess.
ai-tika-vin04t0:432_0: The training rule on breaking up balls of food
ai-tika-vin04t0:433_0: If he doesn’t eat breaking up a ball of food, he’s how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:434_0: The training rule on stuffing the cheeks
ai-tika-vin04t0:435_0: If he doesn’t eat stuffing the cheeks, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:437_0: If he doesn’t eat shaking his hand, he should train in him.
ai-tika-vin04t0:438_0: The training rule on scattering rice
ai-tika-vin04t0:439_0: If you don’t scatter rice while eating, you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:440_0: The training rule on sticking out the tongue
ai-tika-vin04t0:441_0: If he doesn’t eat sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:443_0: If he doesn’t make a chomping sound while eating, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:444_0: The fifth sub-chapter on mouthfuls is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:446_0: If you don’t slurp while eating, you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:447_0: The training rule of the hands,
ai-tika-vin04t0:448_0: If he doesn’t lick his hands while eating, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:449_0: The training rule on licking the bowls,
ai-tika-vin04t0:450_0: If he doesn’t lick his bowl while eating, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:451_0: The training rule on licking the top
ai-tika-vin04t0:452_0: while eating, he should not lick his lips.
ai-tika-vin04t0:453_0: The training rule of material gains
ai-tika-vin04t0:454_0: ‘I will not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:455_0: The training rule on containing rice
ai-tika-vin04t0:456_0: If you don’t discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas, you should train in inhabited areas.
ai-tika-vin04t0:457_0: The training rule on the ground
ai-tika-vin04t0:458_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick, he should train in the six rules.
ai-tika-vin04t0:459_0: The training rule of holding a staff
ai-tika-vin04t0:460_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:461_0: The training rule on what is matchless
ai-tika-vin04t0:462_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone holding a knife who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:463_0: The training rule on holding a weapon
ai-tika-vin04t0:464_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick, he should train in him.
ai-tika-vin04t0:465_0: The sixth sub-chapter on slurping is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:467_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick, he should train in him.
ai-tika-vin04t0:469_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:471_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:472_0: The training rule on lying down
ai-tika-vin04t0:473_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:475_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone who is sitting who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:476_0: The training rule on upper story
ai-tika-vin04t0:477_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:478_0: The training rule of covering the head
ai-tika-vin04t0:479_0: If you don’t give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick, you should train in good qualities.
ai-tika-vin04t0:480_0: The training rule on the ground
ai-tika-vin04t0:481_0: If you don’t give a teaching while sitting on the ground to anyone sitting on a seat who is not sick, you should train in a teaching.
ai-tika-vin04t0:482_0: The training rule on low seats
ai-tika-vin04t0:483_0: If he doesn’t give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:485_0: If he is not sick, he should not give a teaching while standing to anyone sitting who is not sick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-tika-vin04t0:486_0: The training rule on walking behind
ai-tika-vin04t0:487_0: if he is not sick, he should not give a teaching while walking in front who is not sick; he should train in front of them.
ai-tika-vin04t0:488_0: The training rule on walking off the path
ai-tika-vin04t0:489_0: If you’re not sick, I will not give a teaching while walking next to the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:490_0: if he is standing in the vicinity of the robe;
ai-tika-vin04t0:491_0: If one is not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:492_0: The training rule on defecating on cultivated plants,
ai-tika-vin04t0:493_0: If one is not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:494_0: The training rule on defecating in water
ai-tika-vin04t0:495_0: If one is not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,’ this is how you should train.
ai-tika-vin04t0:496_0: The seventh sub-chapter on shoes is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:497_0: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:497_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:498_0: The rules to be trained in are finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:500_0: Venerables, these seven principles for the settling of legal issues that might arise.
ai-tika-vin04t0:502_0: Resolution face-to-face to be resolved face-to-face.
ai-tika-vin04t0:503_0: Resolution through recollection to be granted;
ai-tika-vin04t0:504_0: Resolution because of past insanity to be granted;
ai-tika-vin04t0:505_0: Acting according to what has been admitted;
ai-tika-vin04t0:508_0: Covering over as if with grass.
ai-tika-vin04t0:509_0: Venerables, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.
ai-tika-vin04t0:509_1: In regard to this I ask you, ‘Are you pure in this? You should ask you pure in order: ‘I am pure in this and pure, bright, clarify, and pure in this?’
ai-tika-vin04t0:510_0: The resolution of legal issues is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:512_0: the four rules on expulsion have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:513_0: the thirteen rules on suspension have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:514_0: the two undetermined rules have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:515_0: the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:516_0: the ninety-two rules on confession have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:517_0: the four rules on acknowledgment have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:518_0: the rules to be trained in have been recited;
ai-tika-vin04t0:519_0: the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited and the rainy season in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s Monastic Code. You should train in these Monastic Law:
ai-tika-vin04t0:520_0: The fifth section for recitation is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:521_0: The group of nuns is finished.
ai-tika-vin04t0:522_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
